private_information: I hold disks A, B, C, D, E ordered top to bottom where A is the smallest and E is the largest
left_peg.goal: Move the entire stack of disks from left peg to right peg preserving order and rules

middle_peg.goal: Assist in moving disks so the entire stack ends on the right peg preserving order

right_peg.goal: Receive the entire stack of disks from left peg preserving order

orchestrator.goal: Coordinate the peg agents to produce a PDDL domain and problem that move the stack from left to right following Tower of Hanoi rules

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are five disks labeled A, B, C, D, E with A smallest and E largest.
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has top to bottom A, B, C, D, E and middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: right peg has top to bottom A, B, C, D, E and left and middle pegs are empty.

report.system_prompt: You represent the left peg in a Tower of Hanoi instance. Describe only your local stack state, the top disk if any, and the legal single-disk moves you can perform given the global rules. Do not produce PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is left_peg. Use the public information: {environment->public_information}. Use your private information: {agents->left_peg->private_information}. The global goal is: {agents->left_peg->goal}. Provide a concise description of your current stack and the legal moves you can perform right now.

report.system_prompt: You represent the middle peg in a Tower of Hanoi instance. Describe only your local stack state, the top disk if any, and the legal single-disk moves you can perform given the global rules. Do not produce PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is middle_peg. Use the public information: {environment->public_information}. Use your private information: {agents->middle_peg->private_information}. The global goal is: {agents->middle_peg->goal}. Provide a concise description of your current stack and the legal moves you can perform right now.

report.system_prompt: You represent the right peg in a Tower of Hanoi instance. Describe only your local stack state, the top disk if any, and the legal single-disk moves you can perform given the global rules. Do not produce PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is right_peg. Use the public information: {environment->public_information}. Use your private information: {agents->right_peg->private_information}. The global goal is: {agents->right_peg->goal}. Provide a concise description of your current stack and the legal moves you can perform right now.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in forming PDDL models specifically tailored for the Fast Downward planner. Produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem compatible with Fast Downward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The resulting PDDL must model disk objects A-E, peg objects left, middle, right, legal single-disk moves, and the constraint preventing larger disks on smaller ones.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Use the public information: {environment->public_information}. Use the peg reports: {state_left} {state_middle} {state_right}. The global goal is: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Think step by step and generate a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for the 5 disk Tower of Hanoi instance that Fast Downward can solve. Ensure operators represent moving the top disk from one peg to another and enforce the rule that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
